Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored two goals and set up another to help South Korea win 3-0 over China.
Son Heung-min scored his first goal from the penalty spot in the 11th minute.
Son Heung-min scored his second goal just before halftime with a header.
Jung Seung-hyun added the third goal with a header off a free kick from Son Heung-min.
Post-Match Reflections: South Korea coach Jurgen Klinsmann commented that scoring a goal lifted the atmosphere for the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Korea is looking to qualify for the World Cup for the 11th straight time, while China is aiming to reach the tournament for only the second time.
The South Koreans lead Group C in Asian qualifying with six points, while China and Thailand have three points each.
